Title: Zsh: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
Synopsis:
Input validation errors in Zsh could result in arbitrary code
    execution.

Background.Text: A shell designed for interactive use, although it is also a powerful scripting language.

Description.Text:
Two input validation errors have been discovered in how Zsh parses scripts:

  • Parsing a malformed shebang line could cause Zsh to call a program listed in the second line (CVE-2018-0502)
  • Shebang lines longer than 64 characters are truncated (CVE-2018-13259)

Impact.Text: An attacker could entice a user to execute a specially crafted script using Zsh, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.
